intro: Cerastium morrisonense, commonly known as Morrison's mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features small, hairy leaves and produces clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
